text:
At the moment, the META-INF/context.xml file is copied to the server's
configuration directory during deployment only if the war file is a zip file. 
If the war is a directory, this does not happen.

It would be nice if tomcat could do this for exploded war files, and copy it
again when it detects the META-INF/context.xml file has changed
creator: kbogert@kbogert.dyndns.org

text:
This is done for the war because it's by far the easiest way to read it, and
there's no way of knowing if the context.xml will not specify
exapandWAR="false". If this was not needed, the xml would not be copied around,
as in the expanded webapp scenario.
creator: remm@apache.org
